properties.abstract: The bench on the concrete platform on top of Speer is very comfortable. At first the solid handrail of the platform may seem rather overdone, but the view down to Toggenburg from the exposed platform can indeed cause dizziness. If you ascend on the itinerary along the north ridge described here, which is equipped with steel cables, you have time to get used to being exposed. With some luck you may see ibex, stoically watching you ascend. The information boards of the geology trail on the summit tell you that the geology of Speer is something special. The conglomerate rock called Nagelfluh (small stones embedded in sandstone), normally a feature of the Mittelland, reaches up to a record high altitude of almost 2000 m.
properties.subtitle: European record in sand and stone
properties.title: From Wolzenalp on the north ridge

sac_photos.title: Worm’s-eye view of the Speer north ridge
The first steps on the Speer north ridge
Alpine hiking on Europe’s highest Nagelfluh summit

segments.description: From the Wolzenalp summit station take the hiking trails marked yellow to the summit station of the ski lift. From there hike horizontally below Bremacher Höchi and on the west of Bützalpsattel (1591 m). Descend towards Elisalp for a short while, then take the white-red marked trail traversing to the saddle below the north ridge of Speer (you may descend completely to the picturesque Elisalp, if you like).
segments.title: Wolzenalp - Elisalp – beginning of the north ridge

segments.description: Climb the white-blue marked trail on the north ridge equipped with steel cables to the summit of Speer. The upper part is characterised by a crawling passage.

photos.caption: The narrow crawling passage on the upper part of the north ridge

segments.title: Speer north ridge

segments.description: From Speer descend on a white-red marked mountain hiking trail on the steep south face to reach Oberchäsere. Continue in hilly terrain to reach the narrow road, which via Hinter Höhi leads to the summit station of the chair lift on Mattstock. Take the chair lift down to Amden, Post.
segments.title: Speer - Oberchäsere – Niederschlag chair lift

segments.description: Shortly after Hinter Höhi, at Gäudig (P. 1375), you can descend directly to Amden (add ½ h).
segments.title: Variant without the chair lift directly to Amden

segments.description: If you want to return to Toggenburg, take the marked mountain hiking trail eastward, overcoming the Leiterli escarpment. This way you get back to Wolzenalp, T3+, 2 h. Game reserve, do not stray off the mountain hiking trail.
segments.title: Variant: descent back to Toggenburg
